intro: Amsinckia spectabilis var. bracteosa, commonly known as the bracteosa evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has hairy, branching stems and heart-shaped leaves with a rough texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in dry, open habitats. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental species in native plant gardens.
